trans-unit.source: Learn how you can use the SQL Server Stored Procedure Activity to invoke a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database from a Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can use the SQL Server Stored Procedure Activity to invoke a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database from a Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: You can use the SQL Server Stored Procedure activity in a Data Factory [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) to invoke a stored procedure in an **Azure SQL** Database.
trans-unit.target: You can use the SQL Server Stored Procedure activity in a Data Factory [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) to invoke a stored procedure in an **Azure SQL** Database.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the [data transformation activities](data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md) article which presents a general overview of data transformation and the supported transformation activities.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the [data transformation activities](data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md) article which presents a general overview of data transformation and the supported transformation activities.

trans-unit.source: Text describing what the activity is used for
trans-unit.target: Text describing what the activity is used for

trans-unit.source: Input dataset(s) that must be available (in ‘Ready’ status) for the stored procedure activity to execute.
trans-unit.target: Input dataset(s) that must be available (in ‘Ready’ status) for the stored procedure activity to execute.

trans-unit.source: The input(s) to the stored procedure activity only serve as dependency management when chaining this activity with others.
trans-unit.target: The input(s) to the stored procedure activity only serve as dependency management when chaining this activity with others.

trans-unit.source: The input dataset(s) cannot be consumed in the stored procedure as a parameter
trans-unit.target: The input dataset(s) cannot be consumed in the stored procedure as a parameter

trans-unit.source: Output dataset(s) produced by the stored procedure activity.
trans-unit.target: Output dataset(s) produced by the stored procedure activity.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the output table uses a linked service that links an Azure SQL Database to the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the output table uses a linked service that links an Azure SQL Database to the data factory.

trans-unit.source: The output(s) in the stored procedure activity can serve as a way to pass the result of the stored procedure activity for subsquent processing and/or it can serve as dependency management when chaining this activity with others
trans-unit.target: The output(s) in the stored procedure activity can serve as a way to pass the result of the stored procedure activity for subsquent processing and/or it can serve as dependency management when chaining this activity with others

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the stored procedure in the Azure SQL database that is represented by the linked service that the output table uses.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the stored procedure in the Azure SQL database that is represented by the linked service that the output table uses.

trans-unit.source: Specify values for stored procedure parameters
trans-unit.target: Specify values for stored procedure parameters

trans-unit.source: Let’s consider an example where you want to create a table in Azure SQL database that has two columns:
trans-unit.target: Let’s consider an example where you want to create a table in Azure SQL database that has two columns:

trans-unit.source: Date & time when the corresponding ID was generated
trans-unit.target: Date & time when the corresponding ID was generated

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Name** and **casing** of the parameter (DateTime in this example) must match that of parameter specified in the activity JSON below.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Name** and **casing** of the parameter (DateTime in this example) must match that of parameter specified in the activity JSON below.

trans-unit.source: In the stored procedure definition, ensure that **@** is used as a prefix for the parameter.
trans-unit.target: In the stored procedure definition, ensure that **@** is used as a prefix for the parameter.

trans-unit.source: To execute this stored procedure in a Data Factory pipeline, you need to the do the following:
trans-unit.target: To execute this stored procedure in a Data Factory pipeline, you need to the do the following:

trans-unit.source: Create a [linked service](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-linked-service-properties) to register the connection string of the Azure SQL database where the stored procedure should be executed.
trans-unit.target: Create a [linked service](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-linked-service-properties) to register the connection string of the Azure SQL database where the stored procedure should be executed.

trans-unit.source: Create a [dataset](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-dataset-type-properties) pointing to the output table in the Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Create a [dataset](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-dataset-type-properties) pointing to the output table in the Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: This dataset should reference the linked service in step #1.
trans-unit.target: This dataset should reference the linked service in step #1.

trans-unit.source: Create the stored procedure in the Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Create the stored procedure in the Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Create the below [pipeline](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-copy-activity-type-properties) with the SqlServerStoredProcedure activity to invoke the stored procedure in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Create the below [pipeline](data-factory-azure-sql-connector.md/#azure-sql-copy-activity-type-properties) with the SqlServerStoredProcedure activity to invoke the stored procedure in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: [Monitor the pipeline](data-factory-monitor-manage-pipelines.md) using the data factory monitoring and management views.
trans-unit.target: [Monitor the pipeline](data-factory-monitor-manage-pipelines.md) using the data factory monitoring and management views.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In the above example, the SprocActivitySample has no inputs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In the above example, the SprocActivitySample has no inputs.

trans-unit.source: If you want to chain this with an activity upstream (i.e.
trans-unit.target: If you want to chain this with an activity upstream (i.e.

trans-unit.source: prior processing), the output(s) of the upstream activity can be used as input(s) in this activity.
trans-unit.target: prior processing), the output(s) of the upstream activity can be used as input(s) in this activity.

trans-unit.source: In such a case, this activity will not execute until the upstream activity is completed and the output(s) of the upstream activities are available (in Ready status).
trans-unit.target: In such a case, this activity will not execute until the upstream activity is completed and the output(s) of the upstream activities are available (in Ready status).

trans-unit.source: The input(s) cannot be used directly as a parameter to the stored procedure activity
trans-unit.target: The input(s) cannot be used directly as a parameter to the stored procedure activity

trans-unit.source: The names and casing (upper/lower) of stored procedure parameters in the JSON file must match the names of stored procedure parameters in the target database.
trans-unit.target: The names and casing (upper/lower) of stored procedure parameters in the JSON file must match the names of stored procedure parameters in the target database.

trans-unit.source: Now, let’s consider adding another column named ‘Scenario’ in the table containing a static value called ‘Document sample’.
trans-unit.target: Now, let’s consider adding another column named ‘Scenario’ in the table containing a static value called ‘Document sample’.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish this, pass the Scenario parameter and the value from the stored procedure activity.
trans-unit.target: To accomplish this, pass the Scenario parameter and the value from the stored procedure activity.
